Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk intel-gpu-tools
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: Xorg server and driver bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: X.Org is an open source implementation of the X Window System. It provides the basic low-level functionality that full-fledged graphical user interfaces are designed upon. The xorg-x11-server and xorg-x11 driver packages have been upgraded to newer upstream versions, which provide a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous versions: The xorg-x11-server packages have been updated to version 1.17.2. (BZ#1194842) The xorg-x11-drv-ati driver has been updated to version 7.5.0. (BZ#1194872) The xorg-x11-drv-dummy driver has been updated to version 0.3.6. (BZ#1194873) The xorg-x11-drv-evdev driver has been updated to version 2.9.2. (BZ#1194874) The xorg-x11-drv-fbdev driver has been updated to version 0.4.3. (BZ#1194875) The xorg-x11-drv-intel driver has been updated to version 2.99.917. (BZ#1194876) The xorg-x11-drv-keyboard driver has been updated to version 1.8.1. (BZ#1194877) The xorg-x11-drv-mouse driver has been updated to version 1.9.1. (BZ#1194879) The xorg-x11-drv-nouveau driver has been updated to version 1.0.11. (BZ#1194880) The xorg-x11-drv-openchrome driver has been updated to version 0.3.3. (BZ#1194881) The xorg-x11-drv-synaptics driver has been updated to version 1.8.2. (BZ#1194883) The xorg-x11-drv-v4l driver has been updated to version 0.2.0. (BZ#1194884) The xorg-x11-drv-vesa driver has been updated to version 2.3.2. (BZ#1194885) The xorg-x11-drv-vmmouse driver has been updated to version 13.0.0. (BZ#1194886) The xorg-x11-drv-vmware driver has been updated to version 13.0.2. (BZ#1194887) The xorg-x11-drv-void driver has been updated to version 1.4.1. (BZ#1194888) The xorg-x11-drv-wacom driver has been updated to version 0.29.0. (BZ#1194889) The xorg-x11-server, xorg-x11-drv-qxi, xorg-x11-drv-keyboard and xorg-x11-drv-mouse packages have been updated to ensure correct operation on Power little endian and ARM 64-bit hardware architectures. (BZ#1082779, BZ#1125557, BZ#1191652, BZ#1238464) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, GNOME desktop rendering could overwhelm the console redirection feature of certain G200E-family graphics chips. Consequently, the interactive performance over network video redirection was low. With this update, X video driver has been modified to upload only those tiles of screen data that were actually modified. As a result, performance on the G200E-family graphics chips has been improved. (BZ#1152233) Due to a memory leak in the QXL driver, an X.Org guest could terminate unexpectedly. This update fixes the memory leak, and X.Org no longer crashes. (BZ#1222038) Due to a memory leak in the cursor handling code of the QXL guest driver, the video memory got saturated and caused a corrupted display when the Anaconda installer was formatting a very large disk (over 2 TB). A patch has been applied to prevent cursor data from leaking. As a result, display corruption no longer occurs. (BZ#1222040) Users of xorg-x11-server and xorg-x11 drivers are advised to upgrade to these updated packages. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
